title: Reprocessing of the Parkes 70-cm Survey and Discovery of a New Radio Pulsar in the Large Magellanic Cloud
summary: This paper describes the reprocessing of data from the Parkes 70-cm pulsar survey to detect previously missed pulsars. It details the processing of archived data and the detection of known pulsars, including a new radio pulsar.
usefulness_reason: The paper explicitly mentions a "pulsar survey" and the detection of pulsars, which can be considered a form of "Point Process" in an astronomical context (events occurring at specific points). It also uses "survey data". However, it does not explicitly use the term "Point Process" in a statistical modeling sense, nor "Contextual dataset".
